title: Efficiency modules reduce pollution absorption : r/factorio - Reddit
body: If you can put speed modules into them then they absorb a lot more pollution though. It works a little backwards, we have these greenhouses from K2 that absorb pollution from atmosphere instead of generating it by 5/m. When you add 2 Eff 1 modules it goes "up" to -0.8 absorbed, instead of increasing.
readable_content:
- Zaflis (2022-12-07): Efficiency modules reduce pollution absorption.
- [deleted] (2022-12-07): Time to add some pollution modules instead then
  - bot403 (2022-12-07): The anti module pack. The inefficiency module, the slow module, and the lazy module.
- UntitledGenericName (2022-12-07): Wait it makes sense, hear me out...
- Zaflis (2022-12-07): And what if it's a mechanical air filter machine where you place efficiency modules just to reduce its energy use?
  - dan_Qs (2022-12-07): But one mole of wood still translates to the same ratio of moles of CO2?🤔🤔🤔
- Deadlypandaghost (2022-12-07): Always the mod creator. A developer is only responsible for their built-in modding tools working. The modder is responsible for compatibility between their mod and the game.
  - escafrost (2022-12-07): Speed modules.
  - Guava-King (2022-12-07): Throw production modules instead?
